metadata.synopsis: Outcome dialog between all important characters in the Steel Watch Foundry.Barchus may be dead so his participation is optionalToobin may also be dead, so his participation is also optional. If he is dead, he is replaced by a backup character representing the Gondians.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -1935; -7; 206Use Debug Book to get runepowder bomb(Set quest flags and options > Act 3 Low > 10. Steel Watch Foundry > 5. Get Runepowder BombClick Neural Switchboard > 3. Carefully place the Rune Bomb Powder) wait for the explosion cinematic to finishobserve the cutscene.

82.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
82.context: NodeContext: relieved, can't believe they made it out

140.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
140.text: And the Foundry crumbles behind us - the sound is as sweet as a well-oiled cog.

68.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
68.text: Today you did the impossible - and for that, the Gondians thank you. Whenever you need us, call out - and we shall be there.
68.context: NodeContext: sincere, genuinely eternally grateful to the player

27.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
27.text: Yet we paid the price in blood. So few of us remain - Gond's name will soon fade into the annals of history.
27.context: NodeContext: Sad but also regined - he didn't think there was any other way

133.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
133.text: I must leave now, and gather those of us still standing. Look after this city, my friend - I pray it treats you better than it did us.
133.context: NodeContext: sad smile, trying to be grateful but can't help thinking of everyone who died

78.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
78.text: Yet we paid the price in blood. The name Gondian means little when you are the only left.
78.context: NodeContext: sad, dejected, knows everyone he loves is dead

91.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
91.text: Look after this city, my friend - my place here is no more. But I know it is in good hands.

106.context: CinematicNodeContext: shot of player and whatever remaining gnomes are alive panting, catching their breath. Wulbren appears and claps slowly

36.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
36.text: It's been a while, my friend. I saw the explosion from across the pond - should've known you'd be right in the thick of it.
36.context: NodeContext: like a cat with cream, he's got what he wanted

49.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
49.text: Watchers collapse in the street as we speak. The city thanks you - I thank you.

42.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
42.text: The Gondian menace is finally over - now is the time for the Ironhand Gnomes.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Well done, Wulbren - you got what you wanted.

39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
39.text: What we wanted, my friend - the dead Gondians who litter the streets are as much your kills as they are mine.

24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
24.text: When the time comes, you may call on the Ironhand Gnomes. We will fight with you to defend this city - it is ours, after all.

108.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
108.text: A true leader never forgets those who lifted him up.

121.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
121.text: Oh, it's just beginning - Baldur's Gate, beneath my hand, shall become a beacon of invention and ingenuity, you shall see.

61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
61.text: And Toobin, my old friend. Terribly sorry, but I spotted your daughter floating in the harbour. By the looks of it, she wasn't bobbing for apples.
61.context: NodeContext: cruel, a jab at toobin, anything to hurt him

38.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
38.text: And Toobin, my old friend. Terribly sorry, but I spotted a bunch of Gondians floating in the harbour. By the looks of it, they weren't bobbing for apples.
38.context: NodeContext: cruel, a jab at toobin, anything to hurt him

132.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
132.text: What? But you said you saved them! That you'd help us!
132.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player - horrified. Upset.

92.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
92.text: But it's not over - so long as a single parasitic Gondian remains, Baldur's Gate is under threat.
92.context: NodeContext: turns vicious - he won't rest until every single gondian is dead

139.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
139.text: Wulbren, enough. The Gondians are no more - I am all that is left. You've won.

129.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
129.text: Enough, Wulbren! Gortash enslaved us, forced us to build his Steel Watchers - but no more.

23.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
23.text: Take the city - let the Ironhands reign supreme. I just wish to go home, and to hold my daughter.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: What about Gortash? What if he forces you to build up his Steel Watch once more?

40.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
40.text: I will be long gone from this wretched city before that happens. I am no threat - I am... nothing.
40.context: NodeContext: dejected, alone, all hope lost

18.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
18.text: He'll never find us - we have safe-houses all over the city. We are no threat - I swear it.
18.context:
NodeContext: determined, he will never let the gondians get hurt again
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)

44.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
44.text: Please - if a Gondian told me the sky was blue, I'd look outside and check.

22.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
22.text: Toobin will lie, torment, and scheme until his dying breath. Kill him - or the Ironhands will.
22.context: NodeContext: the mask has truly gone, we see wulbren for what he is - cruel, spiteful and viscious

56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
56.text: You Gondians will lie, scheme, and torment this city until your dying breaths. Let's end this.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands on weaponNodeContext: the mask has truly gone, we see wulbren for what he is - cruel, spiteful and viscious

137.speaker: Barcus Wroot
137.text: Wulbren - enough! I won't watch as you poison your soul - and the brilliant future that remains to the Ironhand Gnomes.

28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
28.text: I thought the Ironhand Gnomes had corrupted you, Wulbren. Now I wonder if it wasn't the other way around.

12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
12.text: Kill Toobin, and you kill all we love: Collaboration. Challenge. Solving problems with the power of reason, creativity, and invention.

110.speaker: Barcus Wroot
110.text: I still want to believe you're better than that, Wulbren. But even I am having my doubts.
110.context: NodeContext: With pain in his voice. He's finally realizing his friend sucks ass, and it hurts.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You carry the light and love of all that is good, Barcus. I think you would make an excellent leader of the Ironhands, don't you?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: By all that glitters, perhaps the Ironhand Gnomes need a new leader. What say you, Barcus?

134.speaker: Player
134.text: There's no honour among thieves, Barcus - and same goes for the Ironhands. Take Wulbren's place, lead them yourself!

85.speaker: Player
85.text: If this was an epic of old, Barcus here would summon his courage - and lead the Ironhand Gnomes.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Perhaps the Ironhand Gnomes need a new leader. What say you, Barcus?

66.speaker: Barcus Wroot
66.text: I say... I say you're right. They deserve a leader who'll encourage them to create, not destroy. They deserve someone like me.
66.context: NodeContext: Barcus character growth moment! Realizing he SHOULD be a leader. Eee!

120.speaker: Barcus Wroot
120.text: I can't save you from yourself, Wulbren. It hurts terribly, but I can't. Toss your values in the bin, if you want. But don't throw out the Ironhands' with them.
120.context: NodeContext: Pain but resolve in his voice.

75.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
75.text: This is ridiculous - Ironhands, kill this man!
75.context: NodeContext: gesturing an order to the iron hands on either side of him -

87.context: CinematicNodeContext: two ironhands on either side of Wulbren in attack pose - look at each other. Then stand up, hands away from their weapons

104.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
104.context: NodeContext: rmeoves his hand from his weapon, realises his own men won't help him. Shocked, outraged

62.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
62.text: The Gondians recognise Barcus Wroot as leader of the Ironhand Gnomes - and look forward to ushering in a new peace between our factions.
62.context: NodeContext: formal, but a slight smile - he hated wulbren too

125.speaker: Barcus Wroot
125.text: It is with a heavy heart that I remove Wulbren Bongle from our ranks. You have until first light to leave the city, Wulbren.

65.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
65.text: I expect treachery from all sides, but you - little Barcus? The boy who followed me from the Underdark, who clung to me like moss to stone?

80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
80.text: When next we meet, my hammer will cleave your skull in two - and that is a promise.

96.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
96.text: Hah! You know why I let this turnip cling to me, after all these years?
96.context: NodeContext: cruel, knowing smile - speaking about barcus. Being a sick.

89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
89.text: Because despite his endless drivel, he lacks the mettle to do anything other than whine. You, on the other hand, I had actual hopes for.
89.context: NodeContext: cruel, knowing smile - speaking about barcus. Being a sick.

52.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
52.text: I thought you a rebel in arms. I see now you were but a snake waiting for its moment to strike.
52.context: NodeContext: disgusted, appalled by the player

115.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
115.text: Keep your precious Gondians - but know that I will not rest until this city is rid of them and their bootlickers.
115.context: NodeContext: a disparaging wave, like he's doing you a favour

26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
26.text: Keep your blind Gondian - I have no use for broken things. But know that I will not rest until this city is rid of the Gondians and their bootlickers.
26.context: NodeContext: a disparaging wave, like he's doing you a favour

141.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
141.text: When the day comes, my hammer will find your skulls - and crack them wide open. Ironhands - move out.

113.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
113.text: No! The bastards must pay for their arrogance, their greed.
113.context: NodeContext: nearly mad with anger, furious, outraged

25.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
25.text: And a true rebel dies for his cause.

95.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
95.text: You would choose a blind, broken Gondian over me? Your brother in arms?
95.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
3.text: No - I won't allow that bastard to live. And a true rebel dies with his cause.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I know a hundred ways to kill you, Wulbren. So I'm only going to say this once - walk away.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You are outnumbered and outmatched, Wulbren. Retreat - now.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Walk away, Wulbren - I won't ask twice.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Wulbren, don't make me burn you to a crisp. Walk away.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Leave now, little Wulbren, or I'll split you from head to navel - and that's a promise.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I'll give you a choice, Wulbren. Leave - or I'll slit your throat and offer your death up to the divine.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I won't let you hurt the Gondians.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Wulbren makes a good point - you must die for the city, Gondians.

58.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
58.text: You saved us, risked your life for us, our families, only to kill us?
58.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

124.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
124.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Toobin has suffered enough - I won't let you hurt him.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Sorry, Toobin - I guess this is it for you.

138.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
138.text: You'd kill me after all we've been through?
138.context: NodeContext: betrayed, upset, horrified by the player

112.speaker: Barcus Wroot
112.text: Kill the Gondians, and you kill all we love: Collaboration. Challenge. Solving problems with the power of reason, creativity, and invention.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: These Gondians are under my protection, Wulbren. You will not harm them.

31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
31.text: You think your chapbook proclamation will stop me?

2.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
2.text: If I have to cut you down to get to them - so be it.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: From one deep gnome to another, I'm asking you to stop this violence.

118.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
118.text: You think your words carry more weight just because we're deep gnomes? Please. You are weak - like all the others. I see that now.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The Gondians are good and just, Wulbren - I've seen it. Don't do this.

1.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
1.text: After all we have accomplished, you would choose them over me? Your brother in arms?
1.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

83.speaker: Player
83.text: You've won, Wulbren - let it go.

30.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
30.text: I planned to make you my right hand in the new reign of Ironhands - I see now you lack the spine.
30.context: NodeContext: betrayed by player, genuinely hurt

107.speaker: Gondian Menalda
107.text: We have safe-houses all over the city - he will never find us, I swear it on my life.
107.context:
NodeContext: pleading
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)

77.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
77.text: I think that if a Gondian told me the sky was blue, I'd look outside and check.

37.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
37.text: Take the city - let the Ironhands reign supreme. I just wish to go home and mourn my daughter in peace.

59.speaker: Gondian Menalda
59.text: Wait - wait! The Banites forced us to make the Steel Watchers, but it's over now. We are his slaves no more.

7.speaker: Gondian Menalda
7.text: If you let us go, you will never hear from us again - I swear it.

20.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
20.text: That was a hell of a show, my friend. Watchers collapse in the street as we speak, and the Foundry?

111.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
111.text: The scent of runepowder drifts through the city like a warm embrace - I see my bomb did the trick.

76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
76.text: Well - it won't stain this beautiful city with its abominations - not anymore.

135.speaker: Gondian Menalda
135.text: You did it - you destroyed the Foundry! Watchers are collapsing in the street as we speak.

15.speaker: Gondian Menalda
15.text: I will gather the survivors - get them to the safe-houses. Thank you for saving us.
15.context:
NodeContext: grateful, jubilant
("safe houses" as in "safehouses" for shelter)
